Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is partially black in section, the interior surface is somewhat damaged but faint traces of black-paint survive, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and faint traces of four lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393240) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393240)
